title: Logo Critique
content:
Considering the professionalism of the people in here, I suppose I will be shred to parts. However, I would like to collect some opinions as well as ideas for improvements.   
   
The company main object is blank CD-R, CD-RW & DVDR discs, and this is a trade company, eg they don't manufacture the CD's, they just sell them. I wanted to stay away from the "euro stars" cliche. Thank you, folks.   
   
 ![Euro Optical Disc](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204510im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/28592.gif)
author: neuroman

comments.content:
What about a disk that looks like an "E"?   
Or since "optical" is in the name, what about making the disk hole an eye?   
   
hhp

I think the lower two signs are not bad, although they could maybe be a little more abstract if you ask me. Although I like the font you've choosen, I don't think it really fits to the sign.   
Try to fiddle a bit with the sign. Use, like hhp also said, the 'optical' angle. Have a look here for what they've done with their logo:   
 [http://www.nob.nl/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204510/http:/www.nob.nl/)   
   
Try some more. You're on the right track.

I actually think the squarish font is a nice fit.   
What if you make the "O" in "OPTICAL" a disk a leave it at that?   
   
(And "Hrant" is fine.)   
   
hhp

_(And "Hrant" is fine.)_   
   
Big Papa is better.

That makes me sound like an African warlord. Cool.   
   
hhp

just a tidbit: the fifth - (bottom right corner) is almost excatly the same as a curling association logo (forget the name sorry) but they have the circles coloured 1 red and 1 blue - otherwise same shape and detail

Thank you all, guys, for you rpositive responce. I gave the 4 finalists to the client, so now I'm waiting for him to decide. And meanwhile let me show you something I think the client would probably approve (sadly, but true)   
   
 ![Yet another logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204510im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/29025.gif)

The ED treatment reminds me of the IMSFA ED logo posted by Cristian G in Feb.   
   
Andrew

Could you be more specific, I would like an URL...and honestly, I haven't seen IMSFA ED logo. But I'm sure that this certain combination of E & D is a bit overused, maybe because it is too obvious ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023204510im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

My first reaction: "Hmmm. I like the top version."   
   
My second reaction: "What if the line which indicated the center piece of the cds (in the bottom right version) was the same weight as that pseudo-connecting line?"   
   
I prefer the squat-square typeface too.
